overview: Lisa Bolger, Chief People Officer at PartnerRe (1,350 employees, ELT of 15), has had a very positive relationship with CompanyA over the last 18 months. CompanyA has won the majority of tenders against Spencer Stuart and Heidrick & Struggles. The relationship started with consultant K in Zurich, then transitioned to AC who has been the main contact. Lisa praised CompanyA's tailored approach, thoughtful questions, alignment with PartnerRe's needs, and flexibility in negotiations. AC's communication style matches well with the CEO. There have been some challenges with ongoing US searches involving multiple stakeholders, but overall the experience has been excellent. Lisa is planning to transition out of her role by early next year.

sections.title: Issues & Risks
For the ongoing claims role search in the US:
Challenges with coordinating meetings and interviews with different stakeholders.
Difficulty in scheduling last-minute interviews with the CFF.
For a previous unsuccessful search with another agency:
Concern about CompanyA potentially overselling candidates.
Need for more listening and focus on client needs, especially from the US team.
General concern:
Balancing execution focus with strategic thinking in ClientCompany's culture.
Questions discussed
points: "Did he meet your communication needs in terms of, you know, regular updates, keeping you in the loop, kind of even just communicating on the channels that suit you, and being available?"
"Do you find in terms of stakeholder management, you know, they respect the lines and authority and kind of, you know, the group in terms of the structure?"

sections.title: "Are they tapping into the other resources that CompanyA has?"
"What do you really look for that or as or, or would like to see more of, even as in value add?"
points: "Have you always been satisfied with the quality and quantity of candidates that have come through to you?"

sections.title: Outline
Introduction and Meeting Purpose
Unknown Speaker and Interviewer greet each other and discuss the rescheduling of the meeting.
points: Interviewer explains her role as an external consultant working with CompanyA for the last five or six years.
The purpose of the meeting is to gather feedback on the relationship with CompanyA, focusing on customer centricity and continuous improvement.

sections.title: Interviewer requests permission to record the meeting for documentation purposes.
ClientCompany's Executive Leadership Team and Role of CompanyA
points: Speaker 1 introduces themselves as the Chief People Officer for ClientCompany, a company with 13,150 employees and an executive leadership team (ELT) of 15.
The company uses CompanyA and other executive search firms for strategic roles and succession planning.
CompanyA has won the majority of tenders in the last two years, with significant activity in the last year to 18 months.
The relationship with CompanyA has been positive, with a focus on thoughtful questions and understanding ClientCompany's needs.

sections.title: CompanyA's Approach and Communication
points: Speaker 1 appreciates CompanyA's tailored approach, focusing on what ClientCompany needs rather than what CompanyA offers.
The early stages of the partnership involve thorough preparation and thoughtful questions to understand ClientCompany's requirements.

sections.title: CompanyA's flexibility in negotiations and fee structures has been appreciated.
points: AC, the main contact from CompanyA, has been praised for his open, honest, and insightful communication style.

sections.title: Challenges and Areas for Improvement
points: Speaker 1 mentions a few challenges, such as coordinating interviews and meetings with different stakeholders.

sections.title: There have been some delays, but overall, communication has been effective.
points: The claims role search in the US has been particularly challenging due to different stakeholders and coordination issues.
Speaker 1 emphasizes the importance of open communication and flexibility in managing these challenges.

sections.title: Stakeholder Management and Job Specification
points: Interviewer inquires about stakeholder management and the role of CompanyA in defining job specifications.
Speaker 1 explains that CompanyA has been involved in creating leader profiles and benchmarking for most searches.
There has been a sharing of resources and data, with a focus on understanding ClientCompany's needs.
Speaker 1 notes that there is sometimes a need for more listening, especially with the US team, to ensure alignment with ClientCompany's requirements.

sections.title: Expectations from a Search Partner
Speaker 1 values tailored services, thoughtful questions, and alignment with ClientCompany's needs.
points: The focus should be on understanding ClientCompany's requirements and providing authentic and challenging feedback.

sections.title: There should be a balance between selling candidates and ensuring a good fit for ClientCompany.
Speaker 1 appreciates the personal touch and relationship-focused approach of CompanyA.
Use of CompanyA's Broader Offerings
points: Speaker 1 mentions that ClientCompany has used CompanyA for learning and development modules in the past.

sections.title: The company prefers a hands-on approach and does not heavily rely on consultants.
points: CompanyA's broader offerings, such as consultancy and benchmarking, are not extensively used by ClientCompany.

sections.title: The focus is on getting things done efficiently rather than extensive consulting.
Satisfaction with Candidates and Ongoing Searches
points: Speaker 1 discusses the satisfaction with the quality and quantity of candidates provided by CompanyA.

sections.title: There have been some challenging searches, but overall, the process has been successful.
points: The ongoing searches are a bit tricky, but there is ongoing communication and support from CompanyA.

sections.title: Speaker 1 appreciates the personal touch and hands-on cooperation during the onboarding process.
Future Plans and Final Thoughts
points: Speaker 1 plans to finish their role at ClientCompany by March, April, or May next year to pursue coaching and consulting.

sections.title: They have been with the company for 20 years and have taken on the role to support the new CEO.
points: Speaker 1 emphasizes the importance of reactive approaches and effective stakeholder management in the search process.
Interviewer thanks Speaker 1 for their insights and wishes them good luck in their future endeavors.

fullTranscript.speaker: Unknown

rawText:
NPS Interview Transcript

Interview Date: 02.10.25

Client: Lisa, PartnerRe

Project: Executive Search

Score: 9

TRANSCRIPT OVERVIEW

https://otter.ai/u/Uzq4AWkiEtJ_nlnymc_I-yTKm9Y?view=summary

Lisa Bolger, Chief People Officer at ClientCompany, discussed her company's relationship with CompanyA. ClientCompany, with 13,150 employees and an ELT of 15, has used CompanyA for key executive roles, with CompanyA winning the majority of tenders in the last two years. Bolger praised CompanyA's tailored services, thoughtful questions, and alignment with ClientCompany's needs. She highlighted the importance of communication, flexibility, and the personal touch in the search process. Bolger also mentioned ongoing searches and her plans to transition out of her role by early next year to pursue coaching.

Issues & Risks

		For the ongoing claims role search in the US:

		Challenges with coordinating meetings and interviews with different stakeholders.

		Difficulty in scheduling last-minute interviews with the CFF.

		For a previous unsuccessful search with another agency:

		Concern about CompanyA potentially overselling candidates.

		Need for more listening and focus on client needs, especially from the US team.

		General concern:

		Balancing execution focus with strategic thinking in ClientCompany's culture.

Questions discussed

		"Did he meet your communication needs in terms of, you know, regular updates, keeping you in the loop, kind of even just communicating on the channels that suit you, and being available?"

		"Do you find in terms of stakeholder management, you know, they respect the lines and authority and kind of, you know, the group in terms of the structure?"

		"Are they tapping into the other resources that CompanyA has?"

		"What do you really look for that or as or, or would like to see more of, even as in value add?"

		"Have you always been satisfied with the quality and quantity of candidates that have come through to you?"

Outline

Introduction and Meeting Purpose

		Unknown Speaker and Interviewer greet each other and discuss the rescheduling of the meeting.

		Interviewer explains her role as an external consultant working with CompanyA for the last five or six years.

		The purpose of the meeting is to gather feedback on the relationship with CompanyA, focusing on customer centricity and continuous improvement.

		Interviewer requests permission to record the meeting for documentation purposes.

ClientCompany's Executive Leadership Team and Role of CompanyA

		Speaker 1 introduces themselves as the Chief People Officer for ClientCompany, a company with 13,150 employees and an executive leadership team (ELT) of 15.

		The company uses CompanyA and other executive search firms for strategic roles and succession planning.

		CompanyA has won the majority of tenders in the last two years, with significant activity in the last year to 18 months.

		The relationship with CompanyA has been positive, with a focus on thoughtful questions and understanding ClientCompany's needs.

CompanyA's Approach and Communication

		Speaker 1 appreciates CompanyA's tailored approach, focusing on what ClientCompany needs rather than what CompanyA offers.

		The early stages of the partnership involve thorough preparation and thoughtful questions to understand ClientCompany's requirements.

		CompanyA's flexibility in negotiations and fee structures has been appreciated.

		AC, the main contact from CompanyA, has been praised for his open, honest, and insightful communication style.

Challenges and Areas for Improvement

		Speaker 1 mentions a few challenges, such as coordinating interviews and meetings with different stakeholders.

		There have been some delays, but overall, communication has been effective.

		The claims role search in the US has been particularly challenging due to different stakeholders and coordination issues.

		Speaker 1 emphasizes the importance of open communication and flexibility in managing these challenges.

Stakeholder Management and Job Specification

		Interviewer inquires about stakeholder management and the role of CompanyA in defining job specifications.

		Speaker 1 explains that CompanyA has been involved in creating leader profiles and benchmarking for most searches.

		There has been a sharing of resources and data, with a focus on understanding ClientCompany's needs.

		Speaker 1 notes that there is sometimes a need for more listening, especially with the US team, to ensure alignment with ClientCompany's requirements.

Expectations from a Search Partner

		Speaker 1 values tailored services, thoughtful questions, and alignment with ClientCompany's needs.

		The focus should be on understanding ClientCompany's requirements and providing authentic and challenging feedback.

		There should be a balance between selling candidates and ensuring a good fit for ClientCompany.

		Speaker 1 appreciates the personal touch and relationship-focused approach of CompanyA.

Use of CompanyA's Broader Offerings

		Speaker 1 mentions that ClientCompany has used CompanyA for learning and development modules in the past.

		The company prefers a hands-on approach and does not heavily rely on consultants.

		CompanyA's broader offerings, such as consultancy and benchmarking, are not extensively used by ClientCompany.

		The focus is on getting things done efficiently rather than extensive consulting.

Satisfaction with Candidates and Ongoing Searches

		Speaker 1 discusses the satisfaction with the quality and quantity of candidates provided by CompanyA.

		There have been some challenging searches, but overall, the process has been successful.

		The ongoing searches are a bit tricky, but there is ongoing communication and support from CompanyA.

		Speaker 1 appreciates the personal touch and hands-on cooperation during the onboarding process.

Future Plans and Final Thoughts

		Speaker 1 plans to finish their role at ClientCompany by March, April, or May next year to pursue coaching and consulting.

		They have been with the company for 20 years and have taken on the role to support the new CEO.

		Speaker 1 emphasizes the importance of reactive approaches and effective stakeholder management in the search process.

		Interviewer thanks Speaker 1 for their insights and wishes them good luck in their future endeavors.
